summary: Jerome A. Cullings was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). He appears in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to December 1978. These documents list his name, salary, and pay during that period, indicating he was a staff member of the committee during its investigation.
significance: Jerome A. Cullings' significance lies in his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating his involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and extent of his role are not detailed in these documents.
